questions.question: Which UNESCO site in Italy is known for its encapsulation of Roman town life before it was buried by volcanic ash in 79 AD?
questions.context: Pompeii offers an unprecedented glimpse into daily life in ancient Rome, with its well-preserved buildings and artifacts.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in the United Arab Emirates holds the record for the world's tallest building as of 2023?
questions.context: Standing at 828 meters, this skyscraper is not only a testament to modern engineering but also a hub of luxury and innovation.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium was the location of Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat in 1815?
questions.context: This battle marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars, significantly altering European political boundaries.

questions.question: Which famous museum in France is home to the Mona Lisa and a vast collection of other masterpieces from across centuries?
questions.context: Founded in 1793, the Louvre is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris.

questions.question: Which dark tourism site in Poland is known for its poignant history as a Nazi concentration camp during World War II?
questions.context: This site serves as a grim reminder of the Holocaust, commemorating all who suffered there from 1940 to 1945.
